Probably, the most vivid example of such events is the invention of writing. An event equal in scope and significance has to be confronted by us today. It is the making of the computer. This is to a great extent hampered by the fact that we deal here, as has already been said, with a complex scientific formation or, in other words, with a domain of interdisciplinary studies.
